title: Breaking the Silence
summary: The journey toward mental well-being is not just psychological but spiritual. The Church must mirror Christ’s compassion for the brokenhearted.
content: Full content for Breaking the Silence. Here we dive deeper into the church’s responsibility and provide specific ways faith communities can support mental health initiatives.

title: Rooted in Scripture
summary: Scripture shows us that we are fearfully and wonderfully made. Elijah, David, and Jeremiah also struggled — and God stayed with them.
content: A more comprehensive view of Biblical figures who struggled with mental health and what lessons modern believers can draw from their stories.

title: Shattering the Stigma
summary: Mental health struggles are not signs of weak faith. The Church must stop shaming and start supporting.
content: An in-depth look at how stigma has crept into church teachings and practical ways to dismantle these harmful beliefs.

title: Integrating Faith and Therapy
summary: Therapy and prayer are both valid. Just as we seek help for the body, so should we for the mind.
content: This post outlines how prayer and therapy work hand-in-hand. Includes resources for faith-based counseling.

title: Community Support
summary: The Church is a family. We must create safe spaces for open conversations about mental health.
content: A guide on how to foster community support within the church, including small group discussions and mental health workshops.

title: Hope in Christ
summary: Even in our darkest moments, we can find hope in Christ. He is our refuge and strength.
content: A reflection on how faith can be a source of comfort during mental health struggles, with personal testimonies.
